text: @MandyQueue See, I can't do anything with words. I need to be able to hear myself think and process what I'm reading/writing, and songs with words are a distraction. I can't focus at all. It's too much input, you know?
RT @jessejanderson: ADHD is starting a new convo with “So anyway…” out of habit.
What kind of music do you listen to in order to get in the studying/homework zone? I do a mix of jazz... like piano bar, club jazz, soul jazz, etc.

The glory that is taking notes by using "Dictate" in Microsoft Word... My ADHD brain can literally just say what I need to have written down instead of typing out everything and getting distracted by misspelled words. #ADHD

@On_An_Impulse Oh my god, yes. Even with daily reminders on my phone, I can't keep any kind of good routine or habit. I'll be successful for a few days, but the effort just dies out after that. I've even tried time-blocking my schedule to force myself to do things, but nope. It doesn't work.

I experienced major RSD today and I literally just kept taking moments to myself to breathe and pull myself together so I wouldn’t burst into tears. I can deal with the other symptoms of #ADHD, but RSD sucks… ugh.

Well, a final decision has finally made. I will stay with the new TA because everyone thinks that is what's best for me and my thesis. I agree. I'm going to take some deep breaths now because these last two weeks have been awful.

And the department chair is all involved now and I'm just over here... trying to ask questions and for advice on my thesis. AND I'M ONLY IN THE PROPOSAL PART!!! I HAVEN'T EVEN STARTED WRITING THE DAMN THING!

The advisor saga continues: I was assigned a new TA yesterday afternoon and I'm just waiting for him to give me the go ahead to chat with him. Well, my original TA decided to start responding to emails last night. Now no one knows what to do. Throw me off a bridge, please.

Has anyone ever had a thesis advisor ghost you? Like, no responses to emails from literally anyone? My department has had to reopen the advisor search for me and it just doesn't feel good. I feel disheartened to be honest.
The best part: my proposal advisor can’t even get my thesis advisor to answer his emails… I hate graduate school sometimes.

I was assigned a thesis advisor, but she hasn’t given myself or my proposal advisor permission for me to contact her yet and now we’re all in a tizzy because literally everyone else in my class has been talking with their advisor while I’m just sitting here…

My husband and I bought a whiteboard to put on the fridge because I kept forgetting these kinds of things. Before I throw something away, I can just write it on the fridge so I can keep reminding myself of what the hell I was cooking. https://t.co/kdBpT23ljI

RT @ADHDJobs: How is it Monday again?! 

Have a great week ADHDers 💫 https://t.co/Efepv1I58b

I saw a tweet about the ADHD thing of waking up in the morning with a song you hate playing in your head that just doesn't go away for the whole day and I've never felt more seen. Why, brain? WHYYYY??!?!
I felt this deeply. https://t.co/FVizpLPWXj
I appreciate y'all responding to this. I personally am a "jammies" person, but pajamas winning makes sense https://t.co/43T6SNNQE0

RT @SittingWithADHD: ADHD is the total inability to relax

Hyperfocus engages. You do extensive research, take notes, make  plans, buy supp…

My Adderall has worn off and now I'm distracted by the superstition on the east coast of wearing your pjs inside-out when it's supposed to snow. ADHD is fun...

Which do you say? I'm curious... and 100% hyperfixating on this so please humor me 🙃
RT @ADHDdesigner: You can’t outrun ADHD, you need to move with it.
RT @ADHDdesigner: If found out you have ADHD as an adult, it may be hard to shift how you view yourself from someone who is lazy, weird, in…

RT @get_inflow: Myth: people with ADHD only procrastinate on difficult or boring tasks.

Fact: people with ADHD will procrastinate on anyth…
In hindsight, it's probably bad to take Adderall and then drink a second cup of coffee....... oh well😬
I resubmitted my thesis idea last night and woke up to, "Yes, this is MUCH better," from my professor. I almost jumped out of bed. Small successes, y'all. Small successes.
I went to sleep last night thinking about my thesis statement and how to make it better... Is this who I've become?

Aaaaand we have a slight topic change already... the primary sources were leading me in a different direction and I've decided to go with it. I'm disappointed, but sometimes research does that to you.
We've made it. A thesis topic has been picked. A tentative title and thesis statement have been written. Here's to the next 6 months of my life working on this thing! #mastersthesis #gradschool

My anxiety showed up yesterday in the form of nausea and I hate it. It reminds me of college when I ended in the hospital several times do to this, but I didn’t anxiety was the culprit. I called out of work because I felt so terrible. Mental illnesses suck, y’all.
listen to music in the shower, texted a friend back, realized an hour and a half passed, yelled at myself, then finally got in the shower… we love an ADHD path of functioning.

I needed to take a shower today, so what did I do? I built the shower caddy we’ve had for two months, reorganized all of our shower things on that shower caddy, scrubbed the tub, looked at a face mask that I wanted to try, looked around for my Bluetooth speaker because I always

This is the beginning of a low. There is no understanding of it. These shifts in mood happen out of nowhere. During these periods, sleep for me is awful, restless. I’m exhausted. I can’t focus because my brain is so foggy. I have to force myself to complete tasks.

I scheduled my first appointment with my psychiatrist yesterday. In two weeks, I’ll have the option to finally take some medication for all of the crap my brain puts me through. I’m excited and nervous at the same time.
#NewProfilePic https://t.co/K7KweJAtNC
Am I about to pull a research paper out of my butt? Yes... It’s due on Sunday and I’m literally just starting the whole thing. Thanks, election stress.

Finished my first week of classes yesterday. I really struggled to stay on task all last week and it definitely sucked when I spent all day yesterday scrambling to get my assignments turned in. I’ve got to kick myself into high gear this week because I will not do that again...
Even though I hated everything about it, I got a 97% on my mock research proposal and an overall 95.5% in my Historical Research Methods class. Thanks to the history gods for this solid haha
RT @jaydubargh: The word for conservative feminism is misogyny

One thing I’ve learned about online graduate school is that it takes a lot of self discipline. No one is there to keep you in check. It’s just you. Keep on that grind my fellow online grad school students! #gradschool #online #gradstudent
